content.description: Scramble up a dirty awkward chimney to gain a stance below a steep face. Climb past fun edges & crimps to the same awkward finish & jingus anchors as Unknown #1. Slightly less run-out, except the finish.
content.location: At the bottom of the descent, walk north along the shore past a jumble of large rocks to a large, dark chimney. Start here or figure out a way to move in from the right to gain the start.

content.description: Clip a first awkward bolt, then continue up a polished face past dis-jointed & awkward cracks to a difficult anchor clip (shared anchor).
content.protection: 10 bolts, rope-twisting single carabiner anchors (rappelling recommended).
content.location: Scramble north along the shore to a notch. Continue up the notch to a good ledge.

content.description:
Off vertical techy start leads to midway ledge.  Follow bolts to either a mantle or face holds left of mantle.  Continue to anchor shared with Rock Lobstar.

Tightly bolted. Safe and fun.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchor shared with Rock Lobstar

climbs.name: Slander Session
climbs.fa: Errett Allen, Bill Serniuk, Corey Hicks 1990 GU

content.description: Start on a narrow face, transition left onto an arete
content.location: On the far right side of slander Crag. Drop down from the other routes to a sandy platform and look for bolts around the back of the edge.

content.description:
Off vertical techy start to midway ledge.  Launch into the sidepulls and crimps. Keep it together until joining Trouterspace near the top.

Possible (recommended) to climb Trouterspace and hang draws on this space crustacean.

A unique and novel adventurous route.

Face climbing leads to stemming up and into a chimney and then a ledge deep in the hole.  Climb the "headwall," go right at the third bolt to a finger crack around the corner. Then back onto the face and anchors.

Um... always shaded? I think it's fun.
content.location: Right side of Slander Crag. Go into your hole!

content.description:
Adventurous and varied.

Climb corner to midway ledge.  Above, climb on arete (preferable to in corner) until the 6th bolt.  Traverse left and climb the ramp/chimney until accessing the final face that leads to the anchor, crux near the top.

Advisable to backclean the 6th bolt after clipping the 7th (easy to do)

Tightly bolted. Safe and fun.

Follow the bolts past good holds, poor holds, and everything in between.

It's climbing in the Gorge eh? Enjoy.

Also, awesome beach to celebrate the send below this one.

An old Errett Allen project now completed.
content.location: Above the beach and to the right of the Tunnel
